panels.description: Shows security alerts mapped to NIST standards (government security rules), highlighting areas like Login Security, System Monitoring, and Network Defense.
panels.title: NIST 800.53 Agent Count

panels.description: Shows security alerts related to Data Privacy laws (GDPR) to highlight potential issues with personal data protection.
panels.title: GDPR Compliance Rules

panels.description: Categorizes threats by 'hacker tactics' (MITRE ATT&CK) to show what types of attacks are occurring (e.g. stealing credentials vs deleting files).
panels.title: Compliance Summary (MITRE ID)

panels.description: Critical. This is the heartbeat of your SOC. It contains all rule-based detections, including your Suricata logs.
panels.title: Wazuh Alerts (Essentials)

panels.description: Critical. This tracks the connection status of your 50 devices. If an agent goes 'Disconnected', you need to know immediately.
panels.title: Wazuh Monitoring (Agent Status)

panels.description: High Value. This provides a 'Current State' view of your network's risk. Essential for prioritizing patching.
panels.title: Wazuh Vulnerabilities (Risk)
Tier 2: High Value for IT Hygiene

panels.description: Excellent for spotting unauthorized open ports (e.g., SSH, RDP).
panels.title: Inventory Ports (Unauthorized Open)

panels.description: Use this to see if unauthorized software is being installed.
panels.title: Inventory Packages (Unauthorized Software)

panels.description: Useful for basic asset identification (Hostname, OS, Architecture).
panels.title: Inventory System (Assets)

panels.description: Tracks who has local admin rights or which accounts are active.
panels.title: Inventory Users (Privileges)
